alert.note: Alert for Amherst; Appomattox; Bedford; Campbell; City of Lynchburg (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 13 at 5:19PM EDT until July 13 at 10:30PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Virginia and south central Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, in central Virginia, Amherst, Appomattox, Campbell and City of Lynchburg. In south central Virginia, Bedford. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 519 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Graham Creek, Carters Creek, Fishing Creek, Buttom Creek, Burton Creek, Dreaming Creek, Falling River, Flat Creek, Blackwater Creek, Buck Branch, Elk Creek and Caldwells Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lynchburg... Rustburg... Concord... Forest... Bocock... Madison Heights... Timberlake... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.

area.areaDesc: Amherst; Appomattox; Bedford; Campbell; City of Lynchburg
